benchmark_details.name: RSVLM-QA (Remote Sensing Vision Language Model Question Answering)
benchmark_details.overview: RSVLM-QA is a new large-scale, content-rich Visual Question Answering dataset for the remote sensing domain, constructed by integrating data from several prominent RS segmentation and detection datasets. It aims to address existing limitations in annotation richness, question diversity, and assessment of reasoning capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance Remote Sensing Visual Question Answering (RSVQA) through a large-scale, richly annotated dataset.

data.source: Data constructed by integrating WHU, LoveDA, INRIA, and iSAID datasets.
data.size: 13,820 images and 162,373 Visual Question Answering pairs
data.annotation: Generated using large language models and a dual-track annotation generation pipeline.

methodology.calculation: VQA accuracy is calculated as the percentage of correct judgments per category.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better understanding and reasoning capabilities of VLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: Ovis2 achieved an average accuracy of 66.96% in the VQA task.
methodology.validation: Stringent quality assurance protocol with both automated screening and manual verification.
